title: Weligama PS Chairman’s killing an incident of gang warfare : Minister
byline: The killing of Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman Lasantha Wickramasekera is an incident of gang warfare which is currently prevailing in the country, Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala told Parliament today.

title: SC orders Alawwa Police to pay Rs. 75,000 to tortured media personnel
byline: The Supreme Court today ordered three police officers attached to the Alawwa Police Station to pay Rs. 75,000 in compensation to a media professional who was subjected to torture and degrading treatment in 2021.

title: Gold falls again as rally comes to halt, stock markets mixed
byline: Gold and silver sank for a second day on Wednesday (Oct 22), bringing a rally in the precious metals to a juddering halt, while stocks were mixed after United States President Donald Trump remarked that a meeting with Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping might not take place.

title: Lanka Premier League 2025 postponed
byline: Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) has announced that the Lanka Premier League (LPL) 2025 will not be held this year as originally planned.

title: Ismat reprimanded for breaching ICC Code of Conduct
byline: Afghanistan player Ismat Alam has been handed an official reprimand for breaching Level 1 of the ICC Code of Conduct during the one-off Test against Zimbabwe in Harare on Tuesday.

title: Feasibility study to extend Kelani Valley Railway line to Ratnapura
byline: The government has approved a proposal to conduct a feasibility study and prepare a detailed plan to extend the Kelani Valley (Kalaniweli) railway line from Awissawella to Ratnapura, in a move aimed at improving public transport and strengthening railway connectivity.

title: ‘Sri Lankan Day’ to be held in December
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved plans to conduct a national program called ‘Sri Lankan Day’, aimed at fostering unity and understanding among the country’s diverse communities.

title: Three children from Mahanama College sexually harassed by school’s security officer: Sajith
byline: Three boys from Mahanama College, Colombo have been sexually harassed by the school’s security officer, Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa told Parliament today.

title: One dead, 10 injured in Mannar bus crash
byline: A 29-year-old man was killed and ten others were injured in a bus accident along the Mannar–Medawachchiya main road this morning (22), police said.

title: Audit urges fair pricing, stricter rules for private hospitals
byline: An audit report has called for an urgent overhaul of Sri Lanka’s private healthcare system recommending a fair and affordable charge structure and the grading of all private medical institutions across the country.

title: More than 60 dead after multi-vehicle crash in Uganda
byline: Sixty-three people have died after several vehicles crashed on a major highway in Uganda, police said on Wednesday.

title: Parliament flares up after killing of Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman
byline: Parliament flared up after Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa informed that the Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman, who was shot at today, has succumbed to his injuries.

title: Vehicle crashes into security gate outside White House
byline: The Secret Service said the driver was arrested and there was no longer a threat. President Trump was in the White House at the time, the Secret Service said.

title: 10-hour water cut in Colombo and suburbs tomorrow
byline: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) has announced a 10-hour water cut in Colombo and several surrounding areas tomorrow (23), from 10.00 a.m. to 8.00 p.m.

title: Manusha appears before Illegal Assets Investigation division
byline: Former Minister Manusha Nanayakkara appeared before the Illegal Assets Investigation Division a short while ago in connection with an ongoing probe.

title: Peru declares 30-day state of emergency in Lima to tackle rising crime
byline: Peru’s President Jose Jeri declared on Tuesday a 30-day state of emergency in the capital Lima and the neighboring province of Callao, saying the move was to battle rising crime.

title: Drug samples from 1981 ordered to be destroyed - JSC
byline: The Judicial Service Commission (JSC) has instructed all magistrates to take immediate steps to remove drug samples weighing less than one kilogramme that have been stored at the Government Analyst’s Department since 1981.

title: Update: Weligama SJB Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman dies after gun attack
byline: The Chairman of the SJB Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha, Lasantha Wickramasekera, also known as ‘Midigama Lasa,’ has died following a gun attack.

title: First endoscopic eustachian tube surgery performed in Sri Lanka
byline: A special surgery, the endoscopic Eustachian tube surgery, was performed for the first time in Sri Lanka yesterday at Negombo General Hospital by a medical team led by ENT Surgeon Vidya Nidhi Dr. Rizny Sakkaff.

title: Unqualified staff dispensing antibiotics at private pharmacies raises concerns
byline: The Society of Government Pharmacists has raised serious concerns over unqualified individuals dispensing medicines, including antibiotics, at private pharmacies across the country.

title: Audit flags wasteful ticket printing at National Museums
byline: The Department of National Museums has been criticized in a recent audit for printing tickets in bulk without considering actual demand, resulting in uneconomical spending.

title: Severe weather strikes; flood threat looms
byline: The Meteorology Department has issued a warning as harsh weather conditions are expected to lash out across the island in the coming days, with a threat to damaging homes and affecting people’s livelihoods

title: CAA announces new maximum retail prices for imported rice
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) has announced revised maximum retail prices (MRPs) for imported rice varieties, effective from Monday (21).

title: Vehicle importers urge 6-month registration window for regular imports, 1 month for personal
byline: The Vehicle Importers Association of Lanka (VIAL) has urged the government to extend the current three-month vehicle registration period for regular importers to six months, while reducing the registration window for personal imports to one month.

title: SL air travel rebounds with 7.5 mn passengers in nine months
byline: The local aviation industry recorded steady growth between January and September 2025, reflecting a continued post-pandemic rebound in travel connectivity and tourism demand.

title: National consumer prices pick up 2.1% in September on rising food prices
byline: Consumer prices measured by the broader National Consumer Price Index picked up pace in September in a mirror image of how the Colombo prices changed for the same month.

title: South Africa on top of points table with win over Pakistan
byline: Laura Wolvaardt’s brilliant 90 set up a dominant 150-run (DLS method) win for South Africa against Pakistan at the ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup 2025.

title: Sri Lanka Unveil Power-Packed Squad for Hong Kong Sixes 2025
byline: Sri Lanka have announced their eight-member squad for the upcoming Hong Kong Sixes Cricket Tournament, scheduled to take place from November 7 to 9 at the Tin Kwong Road Recreation Ground. All-rounder Lahiru Madushanka has been named captain of the side.

title: Sri Lanka must lift investment rate above 30% for faster growth: Indian economist
byline: Sri Lanka must actively explore avenues to raise its investment rate to above 30 percent, if it is to return to a growth trajectory of 6 percent to 7 percent, as the current level of around 20 percent is insufficient for rapid expansion, a top Indian economist said.

title: LGC services fully restored – ICTA confirms no data loss
byline: The Information Communication Technology Agency of Sri Lanka (ICTA) announced that the technical issues which caused the recent disruption to the Lanka Government Cloud (LGC) services have been fully resolved. All affected online government services are now fully operational and accessible to the public.
